title: ELL Logo - Thoughts
content:
I have created this typeface for a bar called Electric Ladyland... I would love to hear what the crew think about it. The client wanted something sexy, provocative but classy. They were also quite keen on the neon sign look. Go wild...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322021119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ell_5952.gif)

 [‹ Mashup,Google Maps,Panorama logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322021119/http:/typophile.com/node/43228 "Go to previous forum topic") [Kerning kerning kerning... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322021119/http:/typophile.com/node/43211 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Daanen

comments.content: It sure is a funky logo and would definitely look sexy in neon. The word ’electric’ looks, well, electric. ’ladyland’ however seems hidden; my guess would be that the high connection between the ’l’ and the a’s obstruct the word shape and thus make it a puzzle... I love the bubbles though.

I would consider what <cite>electric</cite> means in its original context. Not that it <cite>should</cite> be psychedelic in any way, but that you might find some liberties yet to be taken.

Maybe a touch more Mucha and a little less J-Pop.
